issue.title: [R] Implement bindings for lubridate::leap_year
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14823](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14823). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This can be done by combining expressions

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14823?focusedCommentId=17477508) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Issue resolved by pull request 12173
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12173>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14823?focusedCommentId=17490525) by Rok Mihevc (rokm):*
Would it make sense to remap this to c++ binding now that it's available? <https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12373>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14823?focusedCommentId=17503941) by Danielle Navarro (djnavarro):*
yes, absolutely! I assume the correct procedure is to open a new PR and linking back to this issue?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14823?focusedCommentId=17503956) by Rok Mihevc (rokm):*
Yeah, that's neatest. You could also open another PR under this ID stating it's a follow up if you're lazy.
